p: Individuals have some awareness of the age at which the vaccine is administered, the vaccine coverage, and the duration of protection, although they may overestimate or underestimate the actual vaccine coverage according to the parameter k. The vaccine program decreases the perceived prevalence of HIV among HIV− individuals under 29 years of age, causes a slight increase in perceived prevalence in 30–39 year olds, but it has no effect in 40+ year olds ( Fig. 5b). The slight increase in 30–39 year olds occurs because some of those individuals mix with individuals in younger age classes who are still protected by the vaccine and hence have a preference for US.
